panels.description: Max node uptime in the cluster.
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: Number of executing queries.
panels.title: QPS

panels.description: Number of executing queries.
panels.title: Queries

panels.description: Number of failed queries.
panels.title: Failed queries

panels.description: Number of reads from a file that were slow. This indicate system overload.
panels.title: Slow reads

panels.description: Total amount of memory (bytes) allocated by the server.
panels.title: Memory usage

panels.description: Show Distributed server-server connections failures
panels.title: Distributed Connection Errors

panels.description: Number of connections to TCP server (clients with native interface), also included server-server distributed query connections & number of connections to HTTP server
panels.title: Connections

panels.description: Show readonly and partial shutdown replicas, zookeeer exceptions, zookeeer sessions, zookeeper init requests
panels.title: Replication and ZooKeeper Exceptions

panels.description: Show how intensive data exchange between replicas in parts.
panels.title: Replication queue jobs

panels.description: Number of times the number of query processing threads was lowered due to slow reads.
panels.title: Read backoff

panels.description: Number of in flight requests to ZooKeeper.
panels.title: Zookeeper requests

panels.description: Show seconds when replicated servers can be delayed relative to current time,  when you insert directly in *ReplicatedMegreTree table on one server clickhouse need time to replicate new parts of data to another servers in same shard in background
panels.title: Max replica delay

panels.description: Each logical partition defined over `PARTITION BY` contains few physical data "parts"
panels.title: Max parts count for partition

panels.description: Number of launched background merges.
panels.title: Merges

panels.description: Rows read for background merges. This is the number of rows before merge.
panels.title: Merged rows

panels.description: Uncompressed bytes (for columns as they stored in memory) that was read for background merges. This is the number before merge.
panels.title: Merged bytes

panels.description: Number of times a data part was downloaded from replica of a ReplicatedMergeTree table.
panels.title: Replicated part fetches

panels.description: Number of times we prefer to download already merged part from replica of ReplicatedMergeTree table instead of performing a merge ourself (usually we prefer doing a merge ourself to save network traffic). This happens when we have not all source parts to perform a merge or when the data part is old enough.
panels.title: Replicated part fetches of merged

panels.description: Number of times a data part was failed to download from replica of a ReplicatedMergeTree table.
panels.title: Replicated failed part fetches

panels.description: Number of times data parts of ReplicatedMergeTree tables were successfully merged.
panels.title: Replicated part merges

panels.description: Number of times a data part that we wanted doesn't exist on any replica (even on replicas that are offline right now). That data parts are definitely lost. This is normal due to asynchronous replication (if quorum inserts were not enabled), when the replica on which the data part was written was failed and when it became online after fail it doesn't contain that data part.
panels.title: Replicated part data loss

panels.description: BufferFlushSchedulePoolTask: number of active tasks in BackgroundBufferFlushSchedulePool. This pool is used for periodic Buffer flushes.
panels.title: Buffer Flush Schedule Pool

panels.description: CommonPoolTask: number of active tasks in an associated background pool.
panels.title: Common Pool

panels.description: DistributedSchedulePoolTask: number of active tasks in BackgroundDistributedSchedulePool. This pool is used for distributed sends that is done in background.
panels.title: Distributed Schedule Pool

panels.description: FetchesPoolTask: number of active fetches in an associated background pool.
panels.title: Background Fetches Pool

panels.description: MergesAndMutationsPoolTask: number of active merges and mutations in an associated background pool
panels.title: Merges And Mutations Pool

panels.description: MessageBrokerSchedulePoolTask: number of active tasks in BackgroundProcessingPool for message streaming
panels.title: Message Broker Schedule Pool

panels.description: MovePoolTask: number of active tasks in BackgroundProcessingPool for moves
panels.title: Move Pool

panels.description: SchedulePoolTask: number of active tasks in BackgroundSchedulePool. This pool is used for periodic ReplicatedMergeTree tasks, like cleaning old data parts, altering data parts, replica re-initialization, etc.
panels.title: Schedule Pool

panels.description: Number of executing SELECT queries.
panels.title: SELECT queries

panels.description: Number of bytes selected
panels.title: Bytes SELECTed

panels.description: Number of failed SELECT queries.
panels.title: Failed SELECT queries

panels.description: Number of executing INSERT queries.
panels.title: INSERT queries

panels.description: Number of bytes inserted
panels.title: Bytes INSERTed

panels.description: Number of failed INSERT queries.
panels.title: Failed INSERT queries

panels.description: Number of mutations (ALTER DELETE/UPDATE).
panels.title: Mutations
